name: Dark Void™ Zero
description: Rise On! After 20 years, the legendary lost project "Dark Void" is back! To commemorate the game's humble origins, Capcom has commissioned the recreation of the original 8-bit classic, now re-titled "Dark Void Zero.

reviews.review_text: it's been 5 years, can you remove the drm already?

Absolutely terrible DRM. Third-party DRM on top of Steam AND a 5-machine-activation restriction, to this day I have yet to play the game, because it simply won't go past the CD Key activation screen. It returns an 'invalid' error. The product is nothing short of broken and the 5-machine-restriction is a major publisher practically begging its audience to stay away from its own product.   Do not buy, despite the low price-tag, unless you feel adventurous enough to deal with its technical baggage on the customer.  PS: I would like a refund, Capcom. Otherwise, we're done.
Unplayable since CAPCOM XXXXed up the SecuROM...

It feels like a cheap cash in and leaves a lot to be desired of a small rom port. They could have taken a few steps to make this much better and they just decided to take the easiest and laziest route which I do not appreciate, not for the money spent. Would not recommend to anybody unless you're a diehard fan and feel the need to own this.

This game had a lot of hype from reviewers and critics back when it arrived and after playing it I honestly just don't see why.  For me this was a title that looked and sounded better in promos and reviews than it actually ended up being. The controls were not as intuitive as they could have been considering the type of gameplay involved.  The audio failed to impress either to be honest.  The gameplay became stale very quickly too, and I can't really place my finger on the exact reason for that. Perhaps it was the difficulty level, or some combination of the above. I just know that I lost interest in a very short amount of time with the presentation as a whole.  Usually I am a fan of these types of retro styled games but this one just didn't do much for me.
DRM is broken. Cannot even launch game. Invalid serial given when purchased.

let us list the reasons this game should not be purchased for any price-  the moment you boot up the game, you're hit with a securom security code thingymadoodle. this doesn't even work and in most cases won't even let you into the game.  the security thingy only gives you a few licenses so, even though you paid for the game with your own money, you're limited to how many times you download the game.  if you happen to get past all the security stuffs, the game is awful. it has terrible controls and the graphics look less pixelated and more compressed JPEG.   have fun kids.

As all the other reviews indicate, it just doesn't work. Also, the Capcom Support site looks like it hasn't been updated in at least 8 years. 100 kb attachment limit? ♥♥♥♥ing seriously?  SecuROM remains a broken piece of ♥♥♥♥, and I've never had the displeasure of dealing with Steam Support until now.  Don't bother. Just pirate the ♥♥♥♥ing thing... Lord knows far too many of us suckers paid for it.  tl;dr: ♥♥♥♥ SecuROM and Steam knowingly selling a broken product.
not working because of a key which isn't working...so don't buy it!

Looks like the DRM problem is solved.  I have played the game a couple of times (literally). It activated without problems. The game is like a NES game, graphics, sound effects and music. For the 80's gamers it will be a blast from the past. It's not an 'unforgiven' game it has difficulty levels so you can probably avoid fustration (unlike with the real hard NES games). So far so great.
Short, fun, retro-NES style platform game. Totally nails the jetpack controls. Three huge levels of flying, shooting, and collecting powerups.

This is a great little game. I can't say anything about the Securom DRM, but for me I have no problem installing it and playing on a new installation on a new PC, though I did own it within a few months of it came out. I'd say go for it if you want a fun little retro romp that's much better than the game it comes from.

I'm loving this game! It's like I'm back in the 90's playing NES or a good old arcade box!   Dark Void Zero is all that was great in those games, and yes, that includes the difficulty and all the frustrations of trying to clear the game! The music alone is a massive dose of nostalgia, gameplay is reminiscent of Contra or... well... I forgot. It has been a while since then! Anyway, this is a must for anyone who grew up playing games in the 90's, and a good lesson to y'all whippersnappers what good games used to be like.
Extremely hard and unforgiving platform shooter in NES graphic style.

Absolute garbage. Even though it's in my favorite genre, this game has so many flaws its impossible for me to like it. For one thing, yes, it's an NES Homage, but the game design seems to be from the same era - dying just to restart the whole damn game isn't fun at all, especially in a genre about EXPLORATION you are PUNISHED for exploring. Don't let me get started about the atrocious platforming mechanics either.  Do not make the mistake I made and do NOT buy this game.

When I played Dark Void Zero for the first time, I WAS SO SURE that it is an old game from NES. It lasted for the moment when I tried to find it on some NES related websites and found nothing. What does that mean? Dark Void Zero have an amazing atmosphere and while playing, it really feels like old game. It bring so many good memories, when platformer games were simply and fun. It's not a long game, have only 3 levels and 3 boss fights, and if you are not begginer when it comes to this genre, you can complete this game in 1 hour. Is it hard? At first, on hard difficult level, but once you learn how to deal with enemies and boss, it will be piece of cake. I guess that's most fun thing in such a games. I can recommend this game to every platformer games fan, it's a great game.  ABOUT SecuROM DRM - not only the activation limit was raised up to 20 times, but you can also revoke activation limit in this game, check the guide in community hub. Still, it sucks that game which already have a DRM (Steam) are using another one, just to make lifes of us, gamers, harder.
DO NOT BUY!!! There is a problem with SecuROM. The activatino key provided by Steam is wrong and you won't be able to play the game. Steam's support did not work and Capcom did not help either!!
heck yean

Tough, but very good old classic game.  Short, but you can taste the difficulty (even in easy mode), level & weapon design and also the BOSS fight.  Actually, the flying mode is quite hard to control.....

DRM issues are fixed. Game itself is a fun throwback to 8-bit games. Unless you are very good at these types of games, you'll want to play this on Easy mode (there are 3 difficulties) because it remains fairly difficult. There are only 3 levels apparrantly, but the game requires a hefty amount of skill to simply get past the first level. In fact, after 4 hours of trying I wasn't able to get past the first level's boss.
